abstract: Obama administration announces repatriation of Yunis Abdurrahman Shokuri, Morrocan man who has been held at Guantanamo Bay Naval Base prison facility for more than 13 years without trial; move reduces number of detainees there to 115; military says parole-like board has recommended transferring Faez Mohammed Ahmed al-Kandari of Kuwait; repatriation of Shokuri is first in Defense Sec Ashton B Carter's tenure.
lead_paragraph: Yunis Abdurrahman Shokuri’s transfer was a small sign that the Obama administration is still trying to close the prison, despite opposition from Congress and bureaucratic turbulence.

headline.main: U.S. Repatriates Moroccan From Guantánamo, and Approves a Kuwaiti’s Transfer
headline.print_headline: U.S. Repatriates Moroccan From Guantánamo, and Approves a Kuwaiti’s Transfer

snippet: Yunis Abdurrahman Shokuri’s transfer was a small sign that the Obama administration is still trying to close the prison, despite opposition from Congress and bureaucratic turbulence.
